intro: Myripnois maximowiczii, commonly known as the golden myripnois, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
